page.title: 04WOODLEIGH
page.content: In Woodleigh there was once a tailor, a thatcher, a cobbler, a baker, a grocer, a miller, a mason, a rector, a postmaster, a letter carrier and a school teacher. These crafts and trades are now no longer part of the village. There was once a shop, an inn, a school and a church. Now there is just the church, with the vicar dividing his time between three other neighbouring churches. The old school is now used as a parish hall and the post office is just a quiet thatched cottage. Apart from the daily school bus there are no services, just a public telephone box and a letter box. Several new detatched houses were built a few years ago, but Woodleigh is probably quieter now than it was a century ago.
